Authors:
Alica Kosuthova, Samantha Fernandez-Brime, Martin Westberg,
Mats Wedin
Title:
Collolechia revisited, and a re-assessment of ascus
characteristics in Placynthiaceae (Peltigerales, Ascomycota)
Keywords:
ascus structure, classification, morphology, systematics,
taxonomy
Abstract:
We investigated the phylogenetic relationships in the
cyanolichen family Placynthiaceae to test the current generic
delimitations in family, where the monotypic Collolechia currently is
accepted as distinct, based on differences in ascospore and ascus apex
characteristics and the leprose thallus. Bayesian and maximum likelihood
analyses of two sequence marker datasets confirmed that Collolechia
caesia is nested within Placynthium, and should be called Placynthium
caesium (Fr.) Jatta. We re-assess the spore and ascus characteristics
and conclude that Placynthium caesium falls well within the variation in
Placynthium and is thus yet another example of a species that differ
from close relatives by an unusually crustose-leprose thallus
structure.
